source.e1bcc037:
def remove_outlier(col):
    sorted(col)
    Q1,Q3=col.quantile([0.25,0.75])
    IQR=Q3-Q1
    lower_range=Q1-(1.5*IQR)
    upper_range=Q3+(1.5*IQR)
    return lower_range,upper_range
source.a114c38c:
low,high=remove_outlier(t_data["Age"])
t_data["Age"]=np.where(t_data["Age"] > high,high,t_data["Age"])
t_data["Age"]=np.where(t_data["Age"] < low,low,t_data["Age"])
low,high=remove_outlier(t_data["Fare"])
t_data["Fare"]=np.where(t_data["Fare"] > high,high,t_data["Fare"])
t_data["Fare"]=np.where(t_data["Fare"] < low,low,t_data["Fare"])

source.53b497dc:
Data Analysis is basically where you use statistics and probability to figure out trends in data set. It helps you to sort out the “real” trends from the statistical noise.

Exploratory Data Analysis (EDA) is an approach to analyzing data. It’s where the researcher takes a bird’s eye view of the data and tries to make some sense of it. It’s often the first step in data analysis, implemented before any formal statistical techniques are applied.

source.c0dafadb:
Visualizing makes easier to understand the data clear view.
Roughly 20 percent of the Age data is missing whereas Cabin column, it looks like we are just missing too much of that data.

To handle the missing data we have 3 approaches:

-> Drop the columns - if there are very few missing values you can drop those values.

-> Imputation - For numerical columns we can impute the missing data with mode,median or mean value of the respective column

In case you have extreme values such as outliers it is advisable to use the median approach not the mean approach.
